subject: RE: [junit] How to test Graphics and Events in  Swings?
msgSnippet: Abbot (a better bot) is designed to operate on the GUI. It has methods (for example ComponentTester.actionClick()) that does what you are looking for. It is
messageBody:
Abbot (a better bot) is designed to operate on the GUI. It has methods
(for example ComponentTester.actionClick()) that does what you are
looking for. It is open source ( found at http://abbot.sourceforge.net/
). Take a look!




-----Original Message-----
From: Rajeev R [mailto:rrrajeev103@...]
Sent: Monday, March 28, 2005 7:51 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] How to test Graphics and Events in Swings?





Hi,

I am writing an application for testing Swings GUI Applications.
In which I have to test the Graphics font sizes and widths.

Could any one please help me how to use junit in this case?

Also I have to test the events generated(button click,menu button click
etc.)

Could any one please help me how to use junit in the case of testing the
events generated?

Thanks,

Rajeev
